input: Question: Tell me a bio of Marianne McAndrew.
output: Marianne McAndrew is an American actress and singer, born on November 21, 1942, in Cleveland, Ohio. She began her acting career in the late 1960s, appearing in various television shows and films. Her notable film appearances include the role of Irene Molloy in the 1969 film adaptation of the musical "Hello, Dolly!", and as Princess Zareta in the 1976 film "The Blue Bird". She also had recurring roles on popular television shows such as "The Love Boat" and "Fantasy Island". In addition to her acting career, McAndrew was a trained singer and performed in various stage productions, including the Broadway production of "The King and I". She retired from acting in the 1990s and currently resides in California.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Gerhard Fischer (inventor).
output:
Gerhard Fischer is an inventor and entrepreneur who is best known for inventing the first handheld, battery-operated metal detector in 1931. He was born on July 23, 1904, in Frankfurt, Germany, and moved to the United States in 1929, where he became a citizen in 1941.

Fischer's metal detector was originally designed to find and remove nails and other metal debris from wood used in construction projects. However, it soon became popular among treasure hunters looking for buried artifacts and coins.

In addition to his work on metal detectors, Fischer also invented a number of other devices, including a waterproof flashlight and a portable radio receiver. He founded the Fischer Research Laboratory in 1936, which became one of the leading manufacturers of metal detectors in the world.

Fischer received numerous awards and honors for his inventions, including the Thomas A. Edison Foundation Gold Medal in 1987. He passed away on February 23, 1995, leaving behind a legacy of innovation and entrepreneurship.

Joey D. Vieira is an American actor and stunt performer who was born on July 23, 1937, in California, USA. He started his career as a child actor in the 1940s, appearing in films such as "The Kid from Brooklyn" and "The Jolson Story". In the 1950s and 1960s, Vieira became known for his work as a stuntman and stunt coordinator, working on films such as "Spartacus", "The Alamo", and "The Magnificent Seven". He also appeared as an actor in films such as "The Wild One" and "Viva Las Vegas".

In addition to his work in film, Vieira also worked as a stunt coordinator for television shows such as "The A-Team" and "Magnum, P.I." He has received several awards for his contributions to the film and television industry, including the Screen Actors Guild Lifetime Achievement Award in 2016.

Vieira is now retired from the entertainment industry and currently lives in California.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Jean Daullé.
output: Jean Daullé (1703-1763) was a French engraver and printmaker known for his portraits and religious subjects. He was born in Abbeville, France and trained as an engraver in Paris under the renowned engraver Laurent Cars. Daullé later became a member of the Royal Academy of Painting and Sculpture in 1744. He was known for his skillful use of mezzotint, a printing technique that produces a soft, velvety texture. Daullé's work was highly regarded during his lifetime and his prints were collected by art lovers throughout Europe. Some of his most famous works include portraits of Louis XV, Madame de Pompadour, and Voltaire.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Fernando (footballer, born 1984).
output:
Fernando Francisco Reges, commonly known as Fernandinho, is a Brazilian professional footballer born on May 4, 1985. He currently plays as a defensive midfielder for Premier League club Manchester City and the Brazil national team. 

Fernandinho began his professional career with Atletico Paranaense in Brazil before moving to Ukrainian club Shakhtar Donetsk in 2005. He spent eight seasons with Shakhtar and won several domestic titles as well as the UEFA Cup in 2009. 

In 2013, Fernandinho signed with Manchester City for a reported fee of £34 million, becoming the club's most expensive signing at the time. He has since become an integral part of the team, helping them win four Premier League titles, two FA Cups, and five League Cups. 

Fernandinho has also represented the Brazil national team since 2011, earning over 50 caps and participating in the 2014 and 2018 FIFA World Cups. He is known for his physicality, tackling ability, and passing range, and is widely regarded as one of the best defensive midfielders in the world.

Thomas Houghton is a professional rugby league player who currently plays as a hooker for Hull FC in the Super League. He was born on December 5, 1999, in Hull, England.

Houghton started his career at Hull FC's academy and made his first-team debut in 2017. He quickly became a regular in the squad and played an important role in Hull FC's Challenge Cup win in 2017.

Since then, Houghton has established himself as one of the top hookers in the Super League. He is known for his strong tackling, quick play-the-ball, and smart decision-making on the field. He was also named Hull FC's player of the year in 2018.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of John Estes.
output:
John Estes (born January 22, 1989) is an American blues musician who is known for his unique style of fingerpicking guitar and his soulful vocals. He was born and raised in Brownsville, Tennessee and began playing music at a young age. Estes is the grandson of legendary blues musician Sleepy John Estes and learned to play guitar from his grandfather. 

Estes released his debut album, "Sins and Salvation," in 2014 and has since released several more albums, including "The Revelator EP" and "The Time Has Come." He has earned critical acclaim for his music and has been praised for his ability to blend traditional blues with modern influences.

In addition to his music career, Estes is also an advocate for mental health awareness and has spoken publicly about his own struggles with depression and anxiety. He currently resides in Nashville, Tennessee and continues to tour and record new music.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Alma Katsu.
output: Alma Katsu is an American author of historical fiction and horror novels. She was born in Alaska and spent her childhood moving around the United States and overseas, as her parents were in the military. Katsu has a BA in writing from Brandeis University and an MA from the Johns Hopkins Writing Program. She worked for several years as a senior intelligence analyst for the CIA before becoming a full-time writer. Katsu's novels include "The Taker" trilogy, "The Hunger", "The Deep", and "Red Widow". Her books have been translated into over a dozen languages and have been optioned for film and television. Katsu currently lives in Virginia with her husband.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Rennie Fritchie, Baroness Fritchie.
output:
Rennie Fritchie, Baroness Fritchie is a British public servant and a crossbench member of the House of Lords. She was born on August 5, 1945, in Edinburgh, Scotland. After completing her education, she began her career in public service in 1966 as a clerical officer in the Department of Health and Social Security. She later held various senior positions in the civil service, including as the Chief Executive of the National Lottery Charities Board and the Health and Safety Executive.

In 2005, she was appointed as a Life Peeress and took the title Baroness Fritchie of Gloucester. She has been an active member of the House of Lords, contributing to debates on issues such as social care, health, and education. In addition to her parliamentary work, she has also served on several public bodies and committees, including as the Chair of the Standards Committee of the House of Lords.

Throughout her career, Baroness Fritchie has been recognized for her contributions to public service. She was awarded the Companion of the Order of the Bath in 1999 and made a Dame Commander of the Order of the British Empire in 2001. She was also awarded an Honorary Doctorate from the University of Gloucestershire in 2004.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Manuel Salazar (footballer).
output:
Manuel Salazar is a retired Peruvian footballer who played as a forward. He was born on August 5, 1975, in Lima, Peru. Salazar began his professional career with Sporting Cristal in 1994 and played for the club until 1999, winning the Peruvian Primera Division title twice during his time there.

In 2000, Salazar joined Alianza Lima, where he played for three seasons and won another Primera Division title. He then had a brief stint with Universitario de Deportes in 2003 before moving to Mexico to play for Club Necaxa.

After playing for several other Mexican clubs, Salazar returned to Peru in 2008 to play for Cienciano, where he helped the team win the 2008 Copa Sudamericana. He retired from professional football in 2010.

Salazar also played for the Peru national team, earning 28 caps and scoring six goals between 1995 and 2003.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Malcolm Hedding.
output:
Malcolm Hedding is a Christian minister, author, and speaker who was born in South Africa in 1949. He grew up in a Christian household and became a Christian at a young age. Hedding studied at the University of Cape Town and later earned his Master of Theology degree from Dallas Theological Seminary in Texas.

Hedding has served in various leadership positions in the Christian community throughout his career. He was a pastor in South Africa for many years and later served as the Executive Director of the International Christian Embassy Jerusalem. He has also served as the Director of the World Evangelical Alliance's Middle East office and as a member of the steering committee for the Lausanne Movement.

Hedding is known for his expertise on biblical prophecy and has written several books on the topic. He is also a regular speaker at conferences and events around the world. Hedding currently resides in the United States and continues to be active in Christian ministry.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Hibo Wardere.
output: Hibo Wardere is a Somali-born campaigner and author based in the United Kingdom. She is known for her work in raising awareness about female genital mutilation (FGM) and advocating for its abolition. Wardere herself was subjected to FGM when she was just six years old, an experience that inspired her to become a vocal advocate for the rights of women and girls. She has worked with a number of organizations, including the World Health Organization, to educate communities about the dangers of FGM and to promote its elimination. In 2016, Wardere published her memoir, "Cut: One Woman's Fight Against FGM in Britain Today," which chronicles her personal journey and activism. She has been recognized for her work with numerous awards, including the Emma Humphreys Memorial Prize in 2018.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Nisar Ahmad Kakru.
output:
Nisar Ahmad Kakru was a prominent Kashmiri poet, writer, and scholar. He was born on May 28, 1941, in the village of Kakru in the district of Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir, India. He completed his education from the University of Kashmir, where he earned a Master's degree in English literature. Kakru started his career as a teacher, but it was his love for literature that led him to become a renowned poet and writer.

Kakru's poetry is deeply rooted in the Kashmiri culture and tradition. His poems are known for their simplicity, clarity, and the use of everyday language. Kakru's works include several collections of poetry, including "Saroor-i-Khayal," "Chandri Phol," "Dil Kharash," and "Shaam Ke Pukhta." His poetry has been translated into English and other languages.

Apart from his literary contributions, Kakru was also a prominent scholar of the Kashmiri language and literature. He was the former head of the Department of Kashmiri at the University of Kashmir and played a crucial role in the development and promotion of Kashmiri language and literature.

Kakru was awarded the Sahitya Akademi Award in 2009 for his contribution to Kashmiri literature. He passed away on June 3, 2009, in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, leaving behind a legacy of poetry and literature that continues to inspire people.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Don Featherstone (artist).
output:
Don Featherstone (1936-2015) was an American artist and designer best known for creating the plastic pink flamingo lawn ornament. He was born in Worcester, Massachusetts and earned a degree in fine arts from the Worcester Art Museum School. Featherstone worked for Union Products, a plastics manufacturer, and in 1957, was asked to design a plastic flamingo as a lawn ornament. This design became so popular that Featherstone went on to create more than 750 different lawn ornaments for Union Products during his career. 

Featherstone's work became an iconic symbol of American kitsch and pop culture. In 1996, he was awarded the Ig Nobel Prize for Art, an award given to honor achievements that make people laugh, and then think. Featherstone's pink flamingo design was displayed at the Smithsonian National Museum of American History in 1996, and he was inducted into the Plastics Hall of Fame in 1998. 

Featherstone continued to work on his designs until his death in 2015, and his creations remain popular among collectors and enthusiasts of Americana.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Rob Furlong.
output:
Rob Furlong is a retired Canadian sniper who holds the record for the longest confirmed sniper kill in history. He was born on July 1, 1976, in Newfoundland, Canada, and grew up in a military family. Furlong joined the Canadian Armed Forces in 1995 and served in the Princess Patricia's Canadian Light Infantry as a sniper.

In March 2002, during Operation Anaconda in Afghanistan, Furlong made a record-breaking shot of 2,430 meters (2,657 yards) using a .50 caliber McMillan TAC-50 rifle. The shot was made against an enemy combatant and was confirmed by a second sniper team. The previous record was held by a British sniper, Craig Harrison, who made a 2,475-meter (2,707-yard) kill in 2009.

After leaving the military, Furlong worked as a hunting guide and has also been involved in various veteran organizations. He has received numerous awards for his service, including the Canadian Armed Forces Medallion for Distinguished Service and the Queen's Diamond Jubilee Medal.

Jessica Barboza is a Venezuelan fashion model, beauty queen, and social media personality. She was born on July 18, 1987, in Maracaibo, Venezuela. In 2009, she won the title of Miss Earth Venezuela, and later went on to represent her country in the Miss Earth 2009 pageant, where she became a semi-finalist. 

Barboza has worked as a model for various fashion brands and magazines, including Vogue, Cosmopolitan, and Elle. She has also been featured in advertising campaigns for international brands such as L'Oreal, Garnier, and Maybelline.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Botak Chin.
output: Botak Chin, also known as Chin Peng, was a Malayan communist revolutionary who led the Communist Party of Malaya (CPM) in a guerrilla war against the British colonial government in the 1940s and 1950s. He was born in Sitiawan, Perak, Malaysia, in 1924 and joined the CPM during World War II. Botak Chin became the Secretary-General of the CPM in 1947 and led the party's armed struggle against the British colonial government in Malaya until 1960 when the party was defeated. After the defeat, he went into exile in Thailand and lived there until his death in 2013. Botak Chin remains a controversial figure in Malaysian history, with some regarding him as a freedom fighter while others see him as a terrorist.

Owen Wright is a professional surfer from Australia. He was born on January 16, 1990, in Culburra Beach, New South Wales. In 2008, Owen began his professional career and has since become one of the top surfers in the world. He has won numerous competitions, including the Quiksilver Pro France in 2015 and the Hawaiian Pro in 2017. Owen is known for his powerful and dynamic surfing style, and his ability to perform aerial maneuvers with ease.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Shahnaz Pahlavi.
output:
Shahnaz Pahlavi was the eldest daughter of Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, the last Shah of Iran, and his first wife, princess Fawzia of Egypt. She was born on October 27, 1940, in Tehran, Iran, and was educated in Switzerland and the United States. She studied child psychology and worked as a child psychologist in the United States for a few years.

In 1959, Shahnaz married Ardeshir Zahedi, who served as Iran's foreign minister and ambassador to the United States. They had three children together but divorced in 1964.

After the Islamic Revolution in Iran in 1979, Shahnaz lived in various countries, including the United States, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom. She was an advocate for women's rights and worked with various organizations to improve the lives of women in Iran.

Shahnaz was also an accomplished author and published several books, including "The Tale of the Reed Pipe" and "The Fragrant Flower." She passed away on June 27, 2020, at the age of 79.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Jidenna.
output:
Jidenna Theodore Mobisson, known professionally as Jidenna, is an American singer, rapper, and songwriter. He was born on May 4, 1985, in Wisconsin Rapids, Wisconsin, to a Nigerian father and an American mother. Jidenna grew up in Nigeria before moving to the United States for college. 

He first gained recognition with his debut single "Classic Man" in 2015, which peaked at number 22 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. Jidenna's music is a fusion of hip-hop, R&B, and Afrobeat, and he often incorporates African elements into his style and fashion.

Jidenna has released two studio albums, "The Chief" in 2017 and "85 to Africa" in 2019. He has also collaborated with several notable artists, including Janelle Monáe, Kendrick Lamar, and Burna Boy.

In addition to his music career, Jidenna is an advocate for social justice and has been involved in various philanthropic initiatives. He has been recognized for his contributions to music and activism, receiving nominations for multiple awards, including the Grammy Awards.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Roselyn Sánchez.
output:
Roselyn Sánchez is a Puerto Rican actress, singer-songwriter, model, and producer. She was born on April 2, 1973, in San Juan, Puerto Rico. She began her career as a dancer and later moved into acting. 

Sánchez is best known for her roles in the TV series "Without a Trace" and "Devious Maids", as well as the films "Rush Hour 2", "The Game Plan", and "Act of Valor". She has also released several albums and has been nominated for multiple awards throughout her career.

Aside from her entertainment career, Sánchez is also actively involved in philanthropy work. She has supported organizations such as St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, The National Alliance on Mental Illness, and The National Foundation for Autism Research.

Sánchez is married to actor Eric Winter and they have two children together.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Ji Sung.
output: Ji Sung, whose real name is Kwak Tae Geun, is a South Korean actor born on February 27, 1977. He first debuted in the entertainment industry as a model in 1999, and then later on transitioned to acting. Ji Sung's breakthrough role came in 2003, when he played a leading role in the drama series "All In" alongside Lee Byung-hun and Song Hye-kyo. He has since then starred in numerous popular dramas and films, including "Save the Last Dance for Me," "New Heart," "Protect the Boss," "Kill Me, Heal Me," and "Familiar Wife." Ji Sung is known for his exceptional acting skills, which have earned him various awards and accolades throughout his career. He is married to actress Lee Bo-young, and they have two children together.
